channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia expects to be detained by ICE again, attorney says
item.description: The lawyer for Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man wrongly deported by the Trump administration to an El Salvadoran prison and then returned months later, says his client is now facing deportation again.
item.content:encoded:
The lawyer for Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man wrongly deported by the Trump administration to an El Salvadoran prison and then returned months later, says his client is now facing deportation again.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: SpaceX postpones 10th test launch of massive Starship rocket
item.description: SpaceX wants to put the two-stage rocket's massive booster through its paces. On Sunday, it postponed the launch "to troubleshoot an issue with ground systems."
item.content:encoded:
SpaceX wants to put the two-stage rocket's massive booster through its paces. On Sunday, it postponed the launch "to troubleshoot an issue with ground systems."

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Millions in West facing dangerous heatwave amid multiple wildfires
item.description: Parts of California, Oregon and Washington state will experience extreme heat at least through Tuesday, forecasters said.
item.content:encoded:
Parts of California, Oregon and Washington state will experience extreme heat at least through Tuesday, forecasters said.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Illinois officials blast Trump's threat to deploy National Guard in Chicago
item.description: Earlier in August, Trump deployed hundreds of National Guard members to Washington, D.C., as part of what he touted as an effort to reduce crime and root out homelessness.
item.content:encoded:
Earlier in August, Trump deployed hundreds of National Guard members to Washington, D.C., as part of what he touted as an effort to reduce crime and root out homelessness.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: It was the costliest hurricane in U.S. history: Have we forgotten Katrina's lessons?
item.description: Nearly 1,400 people died after Hurricane Katrina crashed into Louisiana and Mississippi. Most of the deaths were in New Orleans, which has had an uneven recovery in the past 20 years.
item.content:encoded:
Nearly 1,400 people died after Hurricane Katrina crashed into Louisiana and Mississippi. Most of the deaths were in New Orleans, which has had an uneven recovery in the past 20 years.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: The state of Michigan hopes its scents will bring people to visit
item.description: The state's tourism campaign offers a fragrance for the summer with notes of the beach, wineries and lavender. They struck a chord with some people relaxing by the water.
item.content:encoded:
The state's tourism campaign offers a fragrance for the summer with notes of the beach, wineries and lavender. They struck a chord with some people relaxing by the water.

(Image credit: Colin Jackson)
item.dc:creator: Colin Jackson

item.title: Smithsonian artists and scholars respond to White House list of objectionable art
item.description: A page published by the White House entitled "President Trump Is Right About the Smithsonian" lists exhibits, educational sites and more that the administration seems to take issue with.
item.content:encoded: A page published by the White House entitled "President Trump Is Right About the Smithsonian" lists exhibits, educational sites and more that the administration seems to take issue with.
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Fans across the country raise their voices at 'KPop Demon Hunters' singalongs
item.description: Netflix's wildly popular movie about a fictitious all-girl rock band is hitting nearly 1,800 movie theaters around the country this weekend as a singalong version.
item.content:encoded:
Netflix's wildly popular movie about a fictitious all-girl rock band is hitting nearly 1,800 movie theaters around the country this weekend as a singalong version.

(Image credit: Netflix)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Boxed in by shifting tariff rules, European shippers pause some U.S.-bound parcels
item.description: New customs regulations take effect August 29, and many European postal agencies and companies say until new systems are set up they can't ship some goods. Gifts worth less than $100 are not affected.
item.content:encoded:
New customs regulations take effect August 29, and many European postal agencies and companies say until new systems are set up they can't ship some goods. Gifts worth less than $100 are not affected.

(Image credit: Nicolas Guyannet/Hans Lucas)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Evacuations ordered as wildfire blazes California's famed Napa County
item.description: Firefighters are working to contain a blaze currently tearing through California's beloved wine country. The Pickett Fire first sparked Thursday afternoon and continued to rage Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
Firefighters are working to contain a blaze currently tearing through California's beloved wine country. The Pickett Fire first sparked Thursday afternoon and continued to rage Saturday.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise
